triples.name: Isabelle (proof assistant)
triples.relevance: Isabelle/HOL is the main proof assistant used in this work for proof reconstruction and verification.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: The paper builds on automated theorem proving to integrate external SMT solvers with Isabelle.

triples.name: Satisfiability modulo theories
triples.relevance: SMT solvers and satisfiability modulo theories are the core external provers that Sledgehammer integrates with.

triples.name: Formal proof
triples.relevance: The work focuses on proof reconstruction from formal proofs generated by SMT solvers in Alethe format.

triples.name: Formal methods
triples.relevance: Formal methods are the theoretical foundation for integrating theorem provers and SMT solvers.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Proof reconstruction supports formal verification by enabling independent verification of SMT solver outputs.

triples.name: Proof assistant
triples.relevance: Proof assistants like Isabelle are the target for Sledgehammer's external ATP integration.

triples.name: SAT solver
triples.relevance: SAT solvers are the foundational technology underlying modern SMT solvers used in this work.

triples.name: Proof reconstruction
triples.relevance: The paper proposes methods and techniques to reconstruct proofs from cvc5 SMT solver output in Alethe format.
